• Turn off the printer then press INK + PAPER + POWER simultaneously.

  • When firmware update is completed all printer`s LEDs will blink simultaneously.
  • Press INK + PAPER at the same time to turn off the printer.

firmware_help.msg:
RU_RU
  • INK + PAPER + NETWORK + POWER .
  • POWER PAPER .
  • , .
  • .
  • POWER .

• Turn off the printer then press INK + PAPER + NETWORK + POWER simultaneously.
  • Hold this buttons until POWER and PAPER LEDs is ON then release buttons.
  • Update list of the devices and select proper firmware then click "update" button.
  • When firmware update is completed POWER LED will start to blink.
  • Press POWER button to turn off the printer.

RU_RU
  • STOP + LEFT ARROW + HOME + POWER .
  • "Program Update Mode" .
  • , .
  • , .
  • .

• Turn off the printer then press STOP + LEFT ARROW + HOME + POWER simultaneously.
  • Printer LCD will display "Program Update Mode" in WHITE color.
  • Update list of the devices and select proper firmware then click "update" button.
  • When firmware update is completed confirm that new firmware version is displayed on the LCD.
  • Press OK button to turn off the printer.

  • Press STOP button to turn off the printer.
  • Attention! Latest version of the firmware for this model has a downgrade lock.
  • Attempt to change firmware on the new printers can lead to the printer damage or erased EEPROM.

firmware_help.msg:
RU_RU
  • "STOP/RESET" + "1" + "COPY" + "POWER" .
  • "Program Update Mode".
  • , .
  • , .
  • "2" , .

• Turn off the printer then press "STOP/RESET" + "1" + "COPY" + "POWER" simultaneously within one minute.
  • Printer LCD will display "Program Update Mode".
  • Update list of the devices and select proper firmware then click "update" button.
  • When firmware update is completed confirm that new firmware version is displayed on the LCD.
  • Press "2" button to turn off the printer.

• First method:
    • Turn off the printer then press UPPER RIGHT CORNER OF THE TOUCH PANEL (#1 on the photo below) + POWER simultaneously.
    • Hold them for about 20 seconds.
    • Release this buttons when power indicator is ON, printer LCD will display "Program Update Mode" in WHITE color.
    • You can find video instruction here.
  • Second method:
    • Turn off the printer then press UPPER RIGHT CORNER OF THE CENTER OF THE TOUCH PANEL (#2 on the photo below) + POWER simultaneously.
    • Hold them for about 20 seconds.
    • Release this buttons when power indicator is ON, printer LCD will display "Program Update Mode" in WHITE color.
  • After you entered service mode update list of the devices and select proper firmware, then click "update" button.
  • When firmware update is completed confirm that new firmware version is displayed on the LCD.
  • Press on the center of the touch screen to turn off the printer.

help.msg: RU_RU Espon Status Monitor Epson Total Disc Control. ` PP-50/-100`, c . ` PP-50/-100`.

In order to succesfully reset waste counters you need to disable Espon Status Monitor and Epson Total Disc Control service. You need to use special `PP-50/PP-100 Reset Key` for this model, standard reset key will not work with this printer. Read description and obtain this key.
RU_RU PP-100, PP-100AP, PP-100II PP-100III . Espon Status Monitor Epson Total Disc Control. ` PP-50/-100`, c . ` -100`.

Software reset will work only for PP-100, it's impossible to reset waste counters on PP-100AP, PP-100II or PP-100III. In order to succesfully reset waste counters you need to disable Espon Status Monitor and Epson Total Disc Control service. You need to use special `PP-50/PP-100 Reset Key` for this model, standard reset key will not work with this printer.
I. How to disable Epson Total Disc Control serivce.
II. Read description and obtain reset key.

• You need latest version of the application in order to work with the CANON devices.
  • In order to execute any service functions you need to start the printer in the service mode.
  • Power cord must be connected and printer is powered off.
  • Press and hold "resume/cancel" button (triangle in the circle).
  • Press ON button while holding "resume/cancel" button (now you are holding both).
  • While holding the ON button press "resume/cancel" button 5 times.
  • Each time when you are pressing "resume/cancel" button the error and power LEDs will light alternately.
  • Release ON button.
  • "Resume/cancel" button must be pressed EXACTLY 5 times.
  • Printer may be started in different mode that is indistinguishable from the service mode when another combination is used, but service functions will not work!

  • In order to execute any service functions you need to start the printer in the service mode.
  • Power cord must be connected and printer is powered off.
  • Press and hold ON button, wait until QR indicator is ON.
  • While holding the ON button press "resume/cancel" button 5 times.
  • Each time when you are pressing "resume/cancel" button the QR indicator will turn ON and OFF alternately.
  • Release ON button.

• You need latest version of the application in order to work with the CANON devices.
  • In order to execute any service functions you need to start the printer in the service mode.
  • Power cord must be connected and printer is powered off.
  • Press and hold "resume/cancel" button (triangle in the circle).
  • Press ON button while holding "resume/cancel" button (now you are holding both).
  • While holding the ON button press "resume/cancel" button 5 times.
  • Each time when you are pressing "resume/cancel" the error and power LEDs will light alternately.
  • Release ON button.
  • "Resume/cancel" button must be pressed EXACTLY 5 times.
  • Printer may be started in different mode that is indistinguishable from the service mode when another combination is used, but service functions will not work!
  • If at the end error LED is still ON (not blinking) and POWER LED is off then service mode was blocked.
  • The only known solution in this case is to replace eeprom chip.

• In order to execute any service functions you need to start the printer in the service mode.
  • Power cord must be connected and printer is powered off.
  • Press and hold LCD area where "resume/cancel" button normally appears (triangle in the circle at the upper right corner).
  • Press ON button while holding "resume/cancel" area (now you are holding both) and wait until LCD is ON.
  • While holding the ON button tap "resume/cancel" 5 times.
  • Each time when you are pressing "resume/cancel" the power LED will light on and turn off alternately, it must be off at the end.
  • If LED state is not changed while "resume/cancel" area is tapped then it was not registered by the printer and does not count.
  • Release ON button and wait until power LED will stop blinking, it must be ON at the end.

• In order to execute any service functions you need to start the printer in the service mode.
  • Power cord must be connected and printer is powered off.
  • Press and hold LCD area where "copy" button normally appears (left third of the screen).
  • Press ON button while holding "copy" (now you are holding both) and wait until LCD is ON, release "copy".
  • While holding the ON button tap "stop/cancel" area 5 times (triangle in the circle in upper right corner).
  • Each time when you are pressing "stop/cancel" the power LED will light on and turn off alternately, it must be off at the end.

question.header: How to reset waste counters and where to buy reset keys?
question.answer:
All information required for waste reset including video tutorials can be found here:

www.wic.support

One time reset key for any supported model can be purchased from here:

www.2manuals.com

or from there using PayPal:

store.payproglobal.com

If you could not purchase a key right now you can use the keyword trial as one time reset key.
That will set all counters to 80% from the maximum (but it will overflow again soon).

question.header: How to fix I/O communication errors and USB errors?
question.answer:
Communication errors almost always appear for one of the following reasons:

  • USB cable is of bad quality or USB port is damaged.
  • Other applications or printing spooler try to communicate with the device.


To resolve this problem, please, try the following without skipping steps:

  • Replace USB cable and USB port. This step is mandatory.
  • After the USB cable has been replaced, shutdown the printer and restart the PC.
  • Shutdown all processes AND services that can potentially communicate with the printer.
  • Shutdown epson/canon services and processes either manually or via this application.
  • In order to do this via WICReset you need to start the application as administrator then select in the main menu on top support >> disable processes and follow instructions.
  • Shutdown any 3-rd party printing software.
  • When all this is done, start the printer, wait until the initialization sequence is completed then try again.

question.header: What to do with the fatal error?
question.answer:
Fatal errors are unrelated to the waste counters and impossible to reset by software, they usualy indicate some mechanical or electrical malfunction. Visually printer notifies about the fatal error by ink and paper LED's blinking simultaniously. In order to find more information about your specific error first click `report` button in the main interface and read description of the last fatal error code that will contain name of the problem and list of possible causes (this feature is not available for some older models). Then you need to either bring the printer to the service center or tyr to fix it manually using service manual. More information can be found here:

What to do with the fatal error?

question.header: How to reset ink out error or to fix unrecognized cartridges?
question.answer:
• For L100/L200/L800 (and only for them) you can reset ink levels for free from the main interface.
  • For other printers from the L series you can reset ink levels from printer's panel (see user manual for details).
  • For other series it is impossible to do by software.
  • If printer shows that cartridges are empty then you need to either replace them with the new ones, reset them according to the manufacturer's instruction if you are using refillable third party cartridges or install chipless firmware if one is available (see here).
  • If printer shows that cartridges are unrecognized or missing then you need to make sure that ink cartridge chips are not damaged and clean, printhead contacts are intact and there are good contact between the two.
  • Sometimes Epson also blocks third party cartridges with firmware update in which case firmware downgrade may help, but first make sure that the problem is indeed with firmware, in this case printer must have latest firmware version, original cartridges must still work and all third party cartridges must be unrecognizable (even if one them is still recognized then the issue is with something else).
